ygData.subject: Re: Hot Key to Re-target Pet
ygData.msgSnippet: This is probably the best and most useful idea I ve heard, ever! Currently, I target mob, charm, F8 Hot Key /pet attack /pet who leader (to easily identify
ygData.messageBody:
This is probably the best and most useful idea I've heard, ever!

Currently, I target mob, charm, F8

Hot Key
/pet attack
/pet who leader (to easily identify which mob is charmed)

Then I F1 twice, play heal song, and try to time the recharm
exactly. :)

To be able to program the F1/F1 would be tremendous, as in hectic
situations I sometimes end up recharming the wrong mob. Pets (or
tanks or nukers for that matter) don't seem to like that much. :)

I think I'm going to have to add a line /pet back off in there,
because I sometimes notice that the mob is still beating on a party
member or a pet. It's sooo frustrating to end up seeing in red...

Labn slashes you for 54
Labn slashes you for 50
Labn misses you
Labn slashes you for 20

Darkfox Reven'tsol
Xegony


From: "Big Daddy Legba" <legba@c...>
> >How to get your pet to attack what the party is beating on:
> >
> >Hot Key "Assist"
> >/g I'm so darn charming!
> >/assist <tank name>
> >/pet attack
> >
>
> Hello!
> I love this hotkey sequence! But is there a way to retarget the
pet? I'm
> hopping there is someway to put the function keys in the hotkey, to
> simulate hitting "F1" twice. Thanks!
> *******************************************************
> Windsinger Legendmaker
> Singer of the 35th Song
> Friends are a Bard's Best Defense!
> *******************************************************
